subject: p19404187
History: Patient with known left upper lobe mass, hemoptysis. Please evaluate for pleural effusion, empyema, interval change of tumor.
Findings: Chest PA and lateral radiograph demonstrates decreased size of the left upper lobe opacity possibly due to resolution of hemorrhage, now measuring 28 in the craniocaudal dimension compared to 35 cm on prior study. There is persisitent if not increased streaky retrocardiac opacities, possibly related to aspiration. No definitive opacification concerning for pneumonia. Minimal left costophrenic angle blunting, likely represents small left pleural effusion. No osseous abnormalities identified.
Impression: Interval decrease in size of left upper lobe opacity, possibly reflecting resolution of prior hemorrhage. Likely small left pleural effusion.
